question:
Refer to the chart showing the percentage of students who prefer various learning styles. Which inference is most supported by the data?

![Learning Styles Chart](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Learning_Styles_Chart.svg/1200px-Learning_Styles_Chart.svg.png)

options.A: Most students prefer auditory learning over kinesthetic learning.
options.B: The majority of students prefer kinesthetic learning.
options.C: Visual learning is equally preferred as auditory learning.
options.D: Very few students prefer visual learning.

explanation: The chart shows kinesthetic learning as having the highest percentage, making it the most preferred style.

question:
Look at the pie chart below representing the distribution of communication methods in a workplace. Which statement best reflects a potential communication challenge?

![Communication Pie Chart](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Pie_chart_of_workplace_communication.svg/1024px-Pie_chart_of_workplace_communication.svg.png)

options.A: The reliance on face-to-face meetings increases documentation efficiency.
options.B: Using emails as the primary communication mode may lead to misinterpretation.
options.C: Phone communication dominates and ensures clarity.
options.D: Instant messaging is preferred over emails.

explanation: The chart shows emails dominate communication. Overreliance may result in miscommunication or lack of tone clarity.

question: In a team meeting, a manager says, 'We value innovation, but we must avoid risks that compromise our core operations.' What is the best interpretation of this statement?

options.A: The manager is against any new ideas.
options.C: Innovation is welcomed only if it doesn’t disrupt essential functions.
options.D: Core operations are irrelevant in decision-making.

explanation: The manager promotes innovation as long as it doesn’t negatively affect fundamental operations.
